messages.subject: Re: Goto F&K, mumei?
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks. It will be finding a new home in the back of some drawer. John                                                           --- In
messages.messageBody:
Thanks. It will be finding a new home in the back of some drawer.
John ---
In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@E...>
wrote:
>
> The workmanship is lower middle level, but not terrible. My guess
is that the signature was not done by the maker. The usual forged
signature approximates the genuine article. The signature here is
totally off in the arrangement of the characters, the placement of
the strokes and the broad, chippy style of carving. The maker of
this piece could have carved a better gimei.
>
> Jim
>
>
>
> Hello Mr Gilbert, Thanks, I had a feeling it would be. I will
remove
> it from display. You say "hopelessly" is it not even a good
piece
> notwithstanding the fake signature? At least then it would have
some
> redeeming value.
> John
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Goto F&K, mumei?
messages.msgSnippet: The workmanship is lower middle level, but not terrible.  My guess is that the signature was not done by the maker.  The usual forged signature approximates
messages.messageBody:
The workmanship is lower middle level, but not terrible. My guess is that the signature was not done by the maker. The usual forged signature approximates the genuine article. The signature here is totally off in the arrangement of the characters, the placement of the strokes and the broad, chippy style of carving. The maker of this piece could have carved a better gimei.

Jim



Hello Mr Gilbert, Thanks, I had a feeling it would be. I will remove
it from display. You say "hopelessly" is it not even a good piece
notwithstanding the fake signature? At least then it would have some
redeeming value.
John

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@E...> wrote:
>
> John,
> Shunjo/Mitsunaga was the nidai of the Hachirobei line and that is
what the inscription reads, but it is hopelessly fake. Kyo Goto no
Kenkyu (1988) by Kasahara Koju and Akimoto Shigeo is the present
definitive reference on waki Goto.
>
> Jim
>
>
>
> Hi All, I need those that are well versed in Goto work to help
me out

of the
> I think Hachirebei line. I have the Gotoke Junanadai No Tousougu
but
> it is mainline only. link:
www.johnstuart.biz/new_page_9.htm I
> would really like to know if this is gimei. Thanks, John
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Goto F&K, mumei?
messages.msgSnippet: John, Shunjo/Mitsunaga was the nidai of the Hachirobei line and that is what the inscription reads, but it is hopelessly fake.   Kyo Goto no Kenkyu (1988) by
messages.messageBody:
John,
Shunjo/Mitsunaga was the nidai of the Hachirobei line and that is what the inscription reads, but it is hopelessly fake. Kyo Goto no Kenkyu (1988) by Kasahara Koju and Akimoto Shigeo is the present definitive reference on waki Goto.

Jim



Hi All, I need those that are well versed in Goto work to help me out
here. This F&K I was told is signed by Goto Shunjo (Mitsunaga) of the
I think Hachirebei line. I have the Gotoke Junanadai No Tousougu but
it is mainline only. link: www.johnstuart.biz/new_page_9.htm I
would really like to know if this is gimei. Thanks, John




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Goto F&K, mumei?

messages.messageBody:
Hi All, I need those that are well versed in Goto work to help me out
here. This F&K I was told is signed by Goto Shunjo (Mitsunaga) of the
I think Hachirebei line. I have the Gotoke Junanadai No Tousougu but
it is mainline only. link: www.johnstuart.biz/new_page_9.htm I
would really like to know if this is gimei. Thanks, John
